Grass fire in Twizel: Eighteen fire crews, four helicopters battle 5ha blaze https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/grass-fire-in-twizel-eighteen-fire-crews-four-helicopters-battle-5ha-blaze/2HEGLLJ6OZAIFM22V3UAEXRNFU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/grass-fire-in-twizel-eighteen-fire-crews-four-helicopters-battle-5ha-blaze/2HEGLLJ6OZAIFM22V3UAEXRNFU/ Fire and Emergency NZ first alerted to the fire at 3.42 and crews arrived 10 min later. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:08:53 +0000 A Fire and Emergency New Zealand spokeswoman said a blaze near Twizel was first reported to them at 3.42pm. The first crews arrived from Twizel 10 minutes later. Photo / File, Bevan Conley
One injured after car crashes into power pole in Taneatua, Bay of Plentyhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/one-injured-after-car-crashes-into-power-pole-in-taneatua-bay-of-plenty/RLXKNMSLJZBKFE2DEYDLNB7A3A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/one-injured-after-car-crashes-into-power-pole-in-taneatua-bay-of-plenty/RLXKNMSLJZBKFE2DEYDLNB7A3A/ One person received minor injuries in the Bay of Plenty crash. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 04:03:07 +0000 Police were notified of a crash in Tāneatua this afternoon.
Police charge former Green MP Golriz Ghahraman over shoplifting allegations https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-charge-former-green-mp-golriz-ghahraman-over-shoplifting-allegations/2GVYVW65IVG4VAN2SVGUW6GAXU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-charge-former-green-mp-golriz-ghahraman-over-shoplifting-allegations/2GVYVW65IVG4VAN2SVGUW6GAXU/ Golriz Ghahraman is facing two shoplifting charges over two December incidents. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 03:38:32 +0000 Former Green MP Golriz Ghahraman. Photo / Garth Badger
Locals worried as more super-spreading seaweed discovered at Aotea-Great Barrier Island https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/locals-worried-as-more-super-spreading-seaweed-discovered-at-aotea-great-barrier-island/CPTGYECYMNGR3JIW4PSDGSJKJ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/locals-worried-as-more-super-spreading-seaweed-discovered-at-aotea-great-barrier-island/CPTGYECYMNGR3JIW4PSDGSJKJ4/ Jamie MortonDiscovery comes amid concern some boaties are flouting rules to control exotic caulerpa. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 03:13:29 +0000 Capable of rapidly growing on the seafloor and smothering life, the bright-green exotic caulerpa seaweed's spread to several sites in Hauraki Gulf and the Bay of Islands has prompted fears of an environmental disaster for New Zealand.
Shearing: Back chasing the records in southern Hawke’s Bay https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/shearing-back-chasing-the-records-in-southern-hawkes-bay/VESDUGCIQBGV3MD53MNWIH7VDE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/shearing-back-chasing-the-records-in-southern-hawkes-bay/VESDUGCIQBGV3MD53MNWIH7VDE/ Doug LaingRod Sutton set four world records. Now he's helping others chase their dreams. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 03:02:54 +0000 Rod Sutton (right) after setting a World nine-hours ewe-shearing record of 721 in 2007, with helper and former World record holder Justin Bell, of Weber. Photo / Doug Laing

Wed, 17 Jan 2024 02:56:00 +0000 The Northland family Wyatt Hughes, Toni Wickman and Journey Wickman lost almost everything, including the pet rabbit, in the garage fire in Poroti. Photo / Denise Piper
December hail storm causes $6 million losses for Canterbury arable farmers https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/december-hail-storm-causes-6-million-losses-for-canterbury-arable-farmers/NW6YOAWI5NEUBPXWV62E5TCJHE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/december-hail-storm-causes-6-million-losses-for-canterbury-arable-farmers/NW6YOAWI5NEUBPXWV62E5TCJHE/ Tim Cronshaw“It’s the worst one I’ve suffered by a long, long shot and I’ve been farming since 1988." Wed, 17 Jan 2024 02:54:04 +0000 A midmorning storm on December 13 left some Canterbury crops covered in a thick layer of hail.
